Description: Ring base sherd of East Greek grey ware open-work pottery stand; dark grey fabric core and grey-brown surface; large quantity of mica; exterior: worn slip over triple moulding at base of splaying stand. Part of incised inscription.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.615, which has 'HERA' cut on the inside, indicating the find-spot. However 613b has 'DIOSK' and 'DERA' (sic) on underside of stand-ring and on inside respectively.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.063)
